metadata.Title: CVE-2020-17498 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 3.2.0 to 3.2.5, the Kafka protocol dissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-kafka.c by avoiding a double free during LZ4 decompression.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-17498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.2.6-1
libwireshark15 - 3.2.6-1
libwiretap12 - 3.2.6-1
libwsutil13 - 3.2.6-1
tshark - 3.2.6-1
wireshark - 3.2.6-1
wireshark-common - 3.2.6-1
wireshark-gtk - 3.2.6-1
wireshark-qt - 3.2.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.6-1').
